text: Tropical Storm Alma was a tropical cyclone in the 2008 Pacific hurricane season. It formed off the coast of Costa Rica on May 29. At first, it was forecast to be a weak storm, However, it quickly gained strength. It then hit land on Nicaragua. Alma was the first tropical storm to ever hit the Pacific coast of Nicaragua. Lots of rain from the storm caused flooding, and eleven people were killed in the area. The remains later became Tropical Storm Arthur in the Atlantic. ==Related pages== * Lists of tropical cyclone names ==References== Category:2008 Pacific hurricane season Category:East Pacific tropical storms Category:Retired tropical cyclone names Category:21st century in Costa Rica Category:2000s in Nicaragua Category:2008 in North America
title: Tropical Storm Alma
